Posted By: JFM2796 (9/22/2011 4:44:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's really good. The things you have to remember during deck building and play that hold it back (from being broken, not from being good) is that a) drawing this with a significant board presence can be a bad thing, since it gives -1/-1 to all the stuff you already have out as well, and that b) drawing more than one of these is problematic, not only because of point a but because only a few of your creatures can actually get the full {4} reduction.  
  
EDIT: Also, apparently they have beauty pageants on Innistrad? Who knew? ...actually, I could see the vampires having beauty pageants, what with their massive aristocracy.
posts.html:
It's really good. EDIT: Also, apparently they have beauty pageants on Innistrad? Who knew? ...actually, I could see the vampires having beauty pageants, what with their massive aristocracy.

@TwoStars: of course you realize that all of Pawn of Ulamog's tokens will die bafore you can use them for anything, right?

Anyway, it's cooler than coolness itself. Bringing any of you creatures with thoughness over 1 two turns earlier has a nearly-infinite combo potential. Zombies eat my brains if this doesn't get in some really broken standard deck.
Sadly, it doesn't really match Innistrad's zombies, given that its best zombie support until now comes from tokens (Undead Alchemist, Army of the Damned, M12's Call to the Grave) which don't get anything positive from this.

Posted By: Vedalken_Arbiter (10/6/2011 3:13:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Iunno, can't help but feel that this is disgustingly overpowered, and will be broken quite soon.  
Ideas:  
Lords. Lotsa lords. Currently the best use for this would probably be Zombie tribal, since it's black, has mostly 2/2 creatures, and has two lords: [Cemetary Reaper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cemetary Reaper) and [Adaptive Automaton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adaptive Automaton).  
The Automaton will be the thing helping this enchantment along for the moment, being a lord for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) after the enchantment drops.  
Can't help but get chilly when I think of what the Birthing Pod archetype might be able to do when splashing some black for this.  
Can't help but laugh hysterically when I drop 2 and play [Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite) for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol).  
  
Side note: this is pretty damn good for Commander, especially in a deck that enjoys creatures going to the graveyard...
posts.html:
